title: PCR/RAT not required for overseas arrivals from March
content: Overseas arrivals in Sri Lanka will soon not be required to do a PCR or Rapid Antigen Test (RAT) prior to their arrival.The directive is to come into effect from 01 March 2022, Chairman of the Civil Aviation Authority Upul Dharmadsa said. Earlier, travellers were required to carry either a COVID-19 PCR, or RAT test report done within 72 hours or 48 hours, respectively, prior to embarkation.
